Class DatasetMatrix¶

class mbff.datasets.DatasetMatrix.DatasetMatrix(label)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class maintains a pair of matrices X and Y, along with their row labels and column labels. Its purpose is to pair together the two matrices of a real-world dataset, namely the feature variables (X) and objective variables (Y). Normally, a DatasetMatrix instance is generated by a dataset source when reading an external dataset.

The rows of X and Y at the same index represent a single sample in the dataset. This means that the matrices X and Y have the same number of rows.

Variables:
  • label – The label used to identify this instance of DatasetMatrix. It will be used when saving / loading the instance too.
  • X – A scipy.sparse matrix where the rows represent samples and the columns represent the feature variables. Can be either a scipy.sparse.csr_matrix instance or a scipy.sparse.csc_matrix instance.
  • Y – A scipy.sparse matrix where the rows represent samples and the columns represent the objective variables. Can be either a scipy.sparse.csr_matrix instance or a scipy.sparse.csc_matrix instance.
  • row_labels – A list of strings where each element is the label of a corresponding sample in X and Y. Has exactly as many elements as X and Y have rows.
  • column_labels_X – A list of strings where each element is the label of a corresponding feature variable in X. Has exactly as many elements as X has columns.
  • column_labels_Y – A list of strings where each element is the label of a corresponding objective variable in Y. Has exactly as many elements as Y has columns.
  • final – A boolean flag which determines whether this DatasetMatrix instance is final or not. Initially False. Calling .finalize() will set this to True. Saving is possible only after finalizing. A loaded DatasetMatrix is always finalized.
get_matrix(matrix_label)[source]¶

Return the X or Y matrix, based on the value of matrix_label.

Parameters:matrix_label (str) – The matrix to get, either "X" or "Y".
Returns:Either matrix in this DatasetMatrix: X or Y.
Return type:scipy.sparse.csc_matrix or scipy.sparse.csr_matrix, depending on whether finalize() has been called or not.
Raises:ValueError – if matrix_label is neither "X" nor "Y"".
get_column(matrix_label, column)[source]¶

Retrieve the entire column specified by the argument column from either matrix X or Y, depending on the value provided for matrix_label.

See also get_column_X() and get_column_Y().
Parameters:
  • matrix_label (str) – The matrix to get the column from, either "X" or "Y".
  • column (int) – 0-based integer index of the column to retrieve.
Returns:

A 1-dimensional Numpy array, as returned by get_column_X() and get_column_Y()
Return type:

numpy.array of size (1, row_count).
Raises:

ValueError – if matrix_label is neither "X" nor "Y"".
get_column_labels(matrix_label)[source]¶

Return the column labels of the matrix specified by matrix_label.

Parameters:matrix_label (str) – The matrix to get the column labels for, either "X" or "Y".
Returns:Either self.column_labels_X or self.column_labels_Y.
Return type:list(str)
Raises:ValueError – if matrix_label is neither "X" nor "Y"".
get_column_X(column)[source]¶

Get a column from the X matrix as a simple 1-dimensional Numpy array. It is recommended to call :py:meth`finalize` first, because finalizing will convert X to a CSC matrix, which is optimized for column slicing and retrieval.

Parameters:column (int) – 0-based integer index of the column to retrieve from X.
Returns:The requested column of X as a 1-dimensional Numpy array.
Return type:numpy.array of size (1, row_count).
get_column_Y(column)[source]¶

Get a column from the Y matrix as a simple 1-dimensional Numpy array. It is recommended to call DatasetMatrix.finalize() first, because finalizing will convert Y to a CSC matrix which is optimized for column slicing and retrieval.

Parameters:column (int) – 0-based integer index of the column to retrieve from Y.
Returns:The requested column of Y as a 1-dimensional Numpy array.
Return type:numpy.array of size (1, row_count).
delete_row(r)[source]¶

Delete the row at index r. This results in the deletion of row r from the X matrix and the Y matrix, in place. Also deletes the corresponding label from row_labels.

Parameters:r (int) – 0-based integer index of the row to delete.
Returns:None
Raises:DatasetMatrixFinalizedError – if finalize() has already been called.
keep_rows(rows_to_keep)[source]¶

Keep only the rows specified by the indices in rows_to_keep, deleting all the other rows from both X and Y, in place. This affects the row_labels as well. For creating a new DatasetMatrix instance containing only a specified subset of rows, see select_rows() instead.

Parameters:rows_to_keep (list(int)) – A list of 0-based integer indices of the rows which must be kept.
Returns:None
Raises:DatasetMatrixFinalizedError – if finalize() has already been called.
select_rows(rows_to_keep, new_label='')[source]¶

Create a new DatasetMatrix instance, which only contains the requested rows of both X and Y. Affects row_labels as well. Does not raise DatasetMatrixFinalizedError, because it doesn’t try to modify the original matrices.

Parameters:
  • rows_to_keep (list(int)) – A list of 0-based integer indices of the rows which must be kept in the new instance.
  • new_label (str) – Optional label for the new instance. If "", then self.label is used.
Returns:

A new DatasetMatrix instance, with X and Y containing only the requested rows.
Return type:

DatasetMatrix
delete_columns_X(columns_to_delete)[source]¶

Delete multiple columns in place from the matrix X. This affects self.column_labels_X too. To delete individual columns from X, see delete_column_X().

Parameters:columns_to_delete (list(int)) – A list of 0-based integer indices of the columns to delete from X.
Returns:None
Raises:DatasetMatrixFinalizedError – if finalize() has already been called.
delete_columns_Y(columns_to_delete)[source]¶

Delete multiple columns in place from the matrix Y. This affects self.column_labels_Y too. To delete individual columns from Y, see delete_column_Y().

Parameters:columns_to_delete (list(int)) – A list of 0-based integer indices of the columns to delete from Y.
Returns:None
Raises:DatasetMatrixFinalizedError – if finalize() has already been called.
delete_column_X(c)[source]¶

Delete a single column in place from the matrix X. This affects self.column_labels_X too. To delete multiple columns from X, see delete_column_X().

Parameters:c (int) – The 0-based integer index of the column to delete from X.
Returns:None
Raises:DatasetMatrixFinalizedError – if finalize() has already been called.
delete_column_Y(c)[source]¶

Delete a single column in place from the matrix Y. This affects self.column_labels_Y too. To delete multiple columns from Y, see delete_column_Y().

Parameters:c (int) – The 0-based integer index of the column to delete from Y.
Returns:None
Raises:DatasetMatrixFinalizedError – if finalize() has already been called.
save(folder)[source]¶

Save X, Y, self.row_labels, self.column_labels_X and self.column_labels_Y as files in the subfolder [folder]/[self.label]. To load these back into a DatasetMatrix instance at a later time, use load().

If the folder [folder]/[self.label] does not exist, it will be created.

Parameters:folder (str) – The root folder in which to create the subfolder named [self.label] in which to save.
Returns:None
load(folder)[source]¶

Load X, Y, self.row_labels, self.column_labels_X and self.column_labels_Y from files in the subfolder [folder]/[self.label]. To save them, use save().

The folder [folder]/[self.label] must exist.

Parameters:folder (str) – The root folder in which to find the subfolder [self.label] from which to load.
Returns:None
finalize()[source]¶

Make final adjustments to the X and Y matrices. Calls .eliminate_zeros(), .check_format() and .tocsc() on both matrices, then set the self.final flag to True.

Returns:None
unfinalize()[source]¶

Reset the self.final flag and converts X and Y back to CSR format. This method should not really be used unless for development or testing purposes.

Returns:None
__eq__(other)[source]¶

Enable equality testing with the == operator.

This equality test includes X, Y, row_labels, column_labels_X and column_labels_Y. All of these properties must be equal between the two given instances for the equality test to pass.

diff(other)[source]¶

Generate a textual description of how this DatasetMatrix differs from the other. For development purposes only.

sparse_equal(m2)[source]¶

Test for the equality of two sparse matrices, by comparing their shape and their content.

Parameters:
  • m1 (scipy.sparse) – A sparse matrix.
  • m2 (scipy.sparse) – Another sparse matrix.
Returns:

True if the shape and contents of m1 and m2 are identical, False otherwise.
Return type:

bool
delete_rows_cols(row_indices=[], col_indices=[])[source]¶

Remove multiple rows and columns simultaneously from the CSR sparse matrix mat. WARNING: Indices of altered axes are reset in the returned matrix.

See this StackOverflow answer.

Parameters:
  • mat (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – The Scipy CSR matrix to delete rows and columns from.
  • row_indices (list(int)) – A list of 0-based integer indices of the rows to delete.
  • col_indices (list(int)) – A list of 0-based integer indices of the columns to delete.
Returns:

A new Scipy CSR matrix instance that does not contain the specified rows and columns.
Return type:

scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
